website_summaries.verdict: The Philips Brilliance 4K Ultra HD Display (288P6LJEB) is a capable 28-inch monitor that offers a sharp UHD image and a generous array of I/O ports.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this monitor. I've owned it for about 2 months and the buttons aren't push-in so they glitch out all the time bringing up menus randomly and sometimes turning off the screen. I put up with that telling myself I'd find a way to disable all the buttons and suck it up, but today it turned off and will not turn back on.. Maybe I did just get a bad one, but I wouldn't suggest risking it. $400 down the drain if I can't get it fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Joel J. Medina

customer_reviews.title: Bezel buttons have a mind of their own.
customer_reviews.text: The picture is bright and lines are sharp on this display. That's good, but that's it. The usb ports regularly stop working for no reason. The SmartImage menu will not stop popping up. It is so irritating. It covers part of the screen and won't stop appearing and disappearing every couple of seconds. This monitor could have been so good. Just needed to have buttons that needed to be pressed instead of touch sensitive. Oh, and it has one dead pixel right in the middle. It is surprisingly easy to ignore. But still, right out of the box? Really?
customer_reviews.author: kelsey

customer_reviews.title: while scaling entire screen so that text and icons aren't super tiny. So
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use with a 2015 MacBook Pro Retina 15" with the AMD R9 graphics. Using it as my sole monitor while in clamshell mode (like a desktop essentially). No complaints on screen color and/or quality. OS X gives ability to utilize full resolution, while scaling entire screen so that text and icons aren't super tiny. So, it's similar to the built-in retina display. No compatibility issues whatsoever. OS X even remembers the positions of windows when I disconnect and reconnect the monitor, switching between the built-in screen and the 28-inch. For the price, I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: "SmartImage" menu makes monitor useless.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this monitor for a year and a half. I like the image but in the past month it was started to randomly flash the "SmartImage" menu for no reason. The menu will stay up for 10 to 15 seconds and then go away to only reappear a few seconds later. While this is happening the monitor is useless since the menu is right in the middle of the screen. Basically this "feature" has ruined a pretty good monitor.
customer_reviews.author: BJY

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy buttons, as others have noted
customer_reviews.text: I think capacitative buttons could be a great idea (physical ones do break all the time, especially on old monitors) but as others have noted, there's some kind of bug in this monitor's firmware where the "smartscreen" button will lose its mind and pop up a menu that can't be dismissed, or go into demo mode permanently. Sometimes, the power button stops registering touches as well, and I simply can't use the monitor at all (can't turn it on). It's too bad, because except for the buttons this is a fine budget monitor, but you'll have to get something else if you want one that works consistently
customer_reviews.author: Matt. S.

customer_reviews.title: Not a user friendly monitor
customer_reviews.text: If I sounds too good to be true believe me it usually isn’t good. I purchased this monitor to attach to my Mac mini. It had an interesting feature of being either a horizontal or a vertical display. However. The setup process COULD NOT BE MORE bizarre. And after accessing the pdf manual online i found that I would need an adapter to attached the monitor to my Mac. What?! Also there is only ONE HDMI port on this thing. That’s right One! I’m frustrated and irritated that such a archaic piece of Flintstone technology is still being pawned off on consumers. Returning it to Bedrock.
customer_reviews.author: T R

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Resolution is great! I use it for gaming and CAD and it performs very well. It came with every possible cable you could need. The speakers are a waste in my opinion, being typical TV speakers, but some may like the idea of having audio available in their monitor. The only drawback is if it doesn't connect properly. There are no drivers, even though the manufacturer website says there are. If you call the manufacturer's tech support, they try to help you, but their troubleshooting is the normal stuff you would do anyway. If it doesn't work they tell you to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: do yourself a favor and buy a monitor with tactile controls instead of one that has faulty touch buttons like this one
customer_reviews.text: After two months, the poorly designed "touch" buttons started to go haywire and the native monitor menu kept turning on and off all by itself. Two days after that, the monitor wouldn't turn on. do yourself a favor and buy a monitor with tactile controls instead of one that has faulty touch buttons like this one.
customer_reviews.author: EBZ

customer_reviews.title: Stellar 4k monitor for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely good monitor for the money. I see things written about "this obviously isn't as good as a <insert far higher price here> monitor but I am not sure what one would get with those. For what I am using this for; general internet and office type usage, this monitor is very nice indeed. Crisp and quick and has built in speakers addressable through the DisplayPort cable (no extra cables for PC hookup) along with the USB hub makes this one a winner. The monitor was very well packaged and arrived totally pristine. Nicest monitor I've had for a long time
customer_reviews.author: Engineers Everything

customer_reviews.title: Great for me! Perhaps not for some people...
customer_reviews.text: Came with tons of different cables, looks great, no dead pixels! Only drawback is that changing your viewing angle really changes the color of the image, if you're using this for yourself as a computer monitor (as I am) you're good! If you want multiple people in different spots around the room to see the same image, perhaps look elsewhere. It still looks pretty good from most angles, just definitely different color and brightness.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money. Useful for Technical Writers.
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this monitor is clear, very bright with usable controls. One flaw: there is a SmartImage menu that pops up at any unannounce moment. I had to search to figure out how to stop it. Hold down the SmartImage bezel button for about 8 seconds. This will also start the demo mode . Press another 8 seconds to end it. So far the SmartImage menu is gone. Thanks to tomshardware dot com.
customer_reviews.author: cruitbuck

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The stand base and the height adjustment are just awesome. cons: You would figure Philips would have 4k worked out by now,but no. The screen looks washed out, there is a blue sorta circle in the bottom middle of the monitor, that will fade away, when you look at it from the side. Stay away until they improve on the quality.
customer_reviews.author: kisha white

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor. It has a crisp, clear display. It is just the right size for my needs, and is light weight and easy to move around. There was no problem getting it hooked up and running in short order. Definitely would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. Great upgrade for general office use. Bright. Clear. Not a gamer so I can't speak to it's suitability for that use case. Bought it to replace my 24" 5 year old Philips monitor that is still working perfectly after all these years.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor 2.5 years ago and used the hell out of it. It is amazing for the price. Well, my monitor started blanking out on me so it was going bad. Called up Phillips and they cross-shipped me a new one. For those of you that don't know, they shipped me a new one before I sent them the bad one. It can be hard to find great customer service these days but these guys have it!
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for office / work use, but read manual
customer_reviews.text: If you make sure to read the manual this is an outstanding monitor for normal office / work use. I take away a star because by default it ships from the factory with DisplayPort v1.1 enabled. You have to read manual to discover that you have to enable v1.2 (and the full resolution at 60hz) from the on-monitor menu system.
customer_reviews.author: Earl E. Bird

customer_reviews.title: 4x Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Wonderfull resolution with room to view more than one document. The mother board I used in the system would not support the Graphics. It was unsettling at best when the picture would frequently go blank and I would have to wait for it to do its thing and come back. To make it work right I had to add a fast graphics card to the system, one that would support the resolution. Even so I haven't been able to push it past a 30fps refresh rate.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Took getting used to, but I dig it now
customer_reviews.text: While it took me a while to get used to the UHD, I'm quite happy now. I went from an Apple 30" cinema to this and I now have far more "real estate." Granted, when I first set it up where I had the cinema display (back of my desk, a little over 3' away) I was squinting and straining, and eventually chose to scale to a lower resolution... which made things not look so great. Then I realized I pretty much just had to think of it as a really big iPad and moved it about 22" from me and all is well now. Though I do still find myself zooming within apps like Safari, Excel, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have built in speakers for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding Monitor. Nice to have built in speakers for everyday use. This type of Ultra HD monitor requires a computer graphics card that can output the HD signal to the monitor. For Maximum performance a graphics card capable of using DisplayPort v1.2 is required.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S.

customer_reviews.title: Monitor is nice, however I can't get the 60Hz refresh rate ...
customer_reviews.text: I just got a new $220 4k Monitor (Samsung - refurbished) and WOW, the new one is GREAT for the price and this one was and is BOGUS Don't bother getting this one! Monitor is nice, however I can't get the 60Hz refresh rate to stay. I have tried many times! Too many times.
customer_reviews.author: Tony B

customer_reviews.title: Terrific monitor
customer_reviews.text: Very clear images, huge screen on which you can open several windows, no problems at all installing. Terrific for the price.
customer_reviews.author: David and Susan

customer_reviews.title: But got gradually worse and worse
customer_reviews.text: Worked decently for about 6 months. But got gradually worse and worse. Frequently it won't connect to my MacBook via HDMI without restarting. Displayport connection is marginally better. Frequent flashes of corruption. Often just goes to sleep while I'm using it. I then have to open my MacBook and close it again to get the display back on.
customer_reviews.author: chrisbrakebill

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Very clear picture. Incredible resolution, just very very crisp. The stand is incredibly well designed. You can effortlessly angle it any which way. Also vertical. Every cable imaginable is included, including audio, HDMI, Display port, etc. The USB hub is a very nice touch, with SS USB ports. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: NRRun

customer_reviews.title: Nice picture, frustrating interface
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is great. However, I found navigating menus via the touch controls to be something of a chore. Moreover, the wording for the number of ports was somewhat misleading. I was led to believe there was more than one HDMI port, but that was not the case. Also, you'll want proper speakers for this thing, because the on-board ones leave much to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Works great with 4:4:4 full 4k resolution @ 60Hz!
customer_reviews.text: Works great with 4:4:4 full 4k resolution @ 60Hz. Took me a while to find a product that would do 4k@60Hz (used for gaming). Great product, extremely high resolution. Very nice packaging and shipping/processing was very fast. Monitor mount is nice and works with any versa mount. It has a lot of connection options, overall I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Torey Winfield

customer_reviews.title: we decided to go for it and are SO glad we did
customer_reviews.text: We were apprehensive about spending this much for a monitor. Since my husband tends to sit at the computer all day, we decided to go for it and are SO glad we did. The screen size is larger than we've had in the past - we're loving the size. As to image quality? We're blown away. Very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Reader

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and quality product
customer_reviews.text: Had it for about a month now. Outstanding monitor. My other monitor (27") has a glossy surface. I like this one better. Super crisp picture. I dumbed down the resolution to see better and to match my other monitor. Both are at 2560x1440. Only issue is it doesn't always wake up from sleep mode. Sometimes windows (7) makes my other monitor active and this one just keeps sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Mohnston

customer_reviews.title: Great display
customer_reviews.text: After a year of use, this monitor is working very well with my Surface Book. Great product for the price
customer_reviews.author: JBSONN

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a good Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Not too bad for a gaming Monitor, does take a little configuration and sometimes loses sync with game....but for the price its not bad.
customer_reviews.author: OceanCzar

customer_reviews.title: Died after only 16 months!!
customer_reviews.text: Was great until it quit waking up. Tried switching cables, operating systems, computers, etc. - it never took an input again. Just stays on and blank.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Collins

customer_reviews.title: Very nice monitor for the less than a third the price ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice monitor for the less than a third the price of an Apple thunderbolt with better resolution and way more inputs. Use it attached via mini-display out from MB Air 11" when at desk. Plan to upgrade to new MacBook if and when it gets another video-out port. Only minor negative is need to reboot when reconnecting otherwise video from MBA not detected.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Webb

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Screen for the price
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this monitor is very good. Materials are sturdy and the multiple cables are included. Some of you may already know this, but if you use the DVI connector you will not get the maximum resolution.
customer_reviews.author: OCGEM99

customer_reviews.title: Stop working within 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I already exchanged once because of some defect issues. now the monitor does not turn on. Poorly made and unreliable product. i wont buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: SOROO PARK

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice monitor, especially for such a low price (I paid $380). It was easy to set-up and I'm loving the 4K resolution.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID L PRICE

customer_reviews.title: The screen is beautiful, but the controls are unintuituve and hard to ...
customer_reviews.text: The screen is beautiful, but the controls are unintuituve and hard to operate. I'd prefer buttons with actual tactile feedback to the capacitive touch interface it has.
customer_reviews.author: Jyo

customer_reviews.title: The image is fine.. I mean
customer_reviews.text: I run 4K at 60Hz with both my Macbook and my PC. The image is fine.. I mean, it's a 4K image.. I don't have a huge frame of reference for it but I'm really happy with it until I find something better I guess. The stand is really flexible (adjustable height, tilt, rotation).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor! High res!
customer_reviews.text: Have it for a year now and I am pleased. Thinking about getting another one.
customer_reviews.author: Galaxy Nexus

customer_reviews.title: My bad for not buying a warranty
customer_reviews.text: Only a few months later and this thing as a flickering black bar on it. My bad for not buying a warranty, but the fact that this thing hasn't been hit, dropped, or anything and it already has a flickering black bar on the left side of the screen isn't really good.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Filip

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great screen, quality build for an amazing price from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Shahar Hashim

customer_reviews.title: great monitor, sharp and clear easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Wow, great monitor, sharp and clear easy to set up. The USB hub built in is great for external speakers, cameras or phone.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A Brown

customer_reviews.title: Irradicate menu won't stop popping up
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is pure garbage. I bought one that kept flashing the menu. I exchanged it, then I bought another one and it's doing the same thing! There should be a recall on this thing.
customer_reviews.author: mikeamazonrevs

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves his new monitor. I'll be lucky if he ever comes down for dinner now.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Not happy.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic monitor. The reason for 2 stars is my personal experience. I bought one of these a few months back. No problems. Love it. Easily a 5 star product. So I bought a second one about a month ago. Dead pixel. Got a replacement. Dead pixel on that one too. Got a third replacement. It has several dead pixels. This is getting very annoying. I've had my hands on four of these monitors and only one of them has all pixels intact. It's amazing that with 8 million pixels, missing one or two of them is so noticeable, but it is.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Nice screen. Resolution is superb
customer_reviews.text: Nice screen. Resolution is superb, and love playing 4K videos on it.
customer_reviews.author: Hillary H

customer_reviews.title: poor colors
customer_reviews.text: For a bargain price we got what we deserved. Poor dull colors. Not for those who like photography. Even if it's just a hobby. Using "lightroom" makes no sense with this display. Viewing angle is almost like on a laptop. We returned it an got NEC.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No complains about the monitor, but I do now ...
customer_reviews.text: No complains about the monitor, but I do now have to a new graphics card as the mouse lags on the screen. and subsequently must but a new power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... 14 of these monitors for work and they are amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 14 of these monitors for work and they are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: W. Wheatley

customer_reviews.title: 4K is gorgeous
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with this purchase. I will say that one other reviewer mentioned a faint line down the middle and it is there but only visible in certain situations. For those that want 60 Hz, be sure to make sure your hardware can produce 4K, if you can't a cheaper 30Hz display is perfectly acceptable for all but gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Tomberlin

customer_reviews.title: I think this is a great monitor for the price
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great monitor for the price. Not much bad to say about it except the occasional quirky behaviors mentioned in some of the other reviews - very infrequent and easily resolved however.
customer_reviews.author: Bob San Diego

customer_reviews.title: This is very best monitor I have for now
customer_reviews.text: This is very best monitor I have for now, and a great the price .The stand is very badly design, very shaky, this is my only complain Thank you JD.
customer_reviews.author: John Dessarzin

customer_reviews.title: Still works great for gaming $k @ 60hz
customer_reviews.text: Right side of screen flickers every so often which requires you to restart the display. Also doesn't have MST but that's my fault for not doing my research. Still works great for gaming $k @ 60hz.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Crowd

customer_reviews.title: Great displays for the price
customer_reviews.text: Ended up ordering five of these units. Great displays for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin breaux

customer_reviews.title: Used as hd monitor so far. Expect same quality ...
customer_reviews.text: Used as hd monitor so far. Expect same quality after my new uhd graphics card is hooked up. Stay tuned
customer_reviews.author: albert waldman

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for about two weeks now, and I have had not had any problems with it. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Zoller

customer_reviews.title: The quality is worse than a Apple Thunderbolt display
customer_reviews.text: Using with a 2012 Macbook Pro via DisplayPort. The quality is worse than a Apple Thunderbolt display, had to make adjustments on the display itself to get it looking just ok. Using it with my Mac in mirror and clamshell mode, sometimes when it wakes from sleep a bunch of windows are moved mostly off screen into the lower left corner and I have to drag them all back into view. Not sure if this is purely a mac problem but I've never run into this using other displays in this configuration.
customer_reviews.author: asilmusic

customer_reviews.title: I've owned this for over a year and this was not that good.
customer_reviews.text: I would get screen tearing like at least once a week and the screen would constantly just turn all black for like 2 seconds out of nowhere. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Prometheus

customer_reviews.title: This monitor is great for Cad Cam and large spreadsheets
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is great for Cad Cam and large spreadsheets. The drawback is that at full resolution the menu fonts are so small they are hard to view comfortably. The solution is to set the desktop DPI to 200% which can be done in using font scaling as in XP. The option is under Control Panel...Display...Select Cutsom DPI setting... and select 200%. This will give you a 192 dpi and scale up most of the text you see easily.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Smiser

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am in LOVE! Best Monitor I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Mobley

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor. The HDMI and DVI didn't work with ...
customer_reviews.text: Great monitor. The HDMI and DVI didn't work with my card to get 60Hz 4K (it only got 30Hz), but the PC cable that came with the monitor worked just fine. Just make sure your video card can handle that kind of input.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Larimore

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have just hooked it up and so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Crane

customer_reviews.title: Low quality tried to get this with 5k imac the ...
customer_reviews.text: Low quality tried to get this with 5k imac the pixels are so poorly managed you cant see anything at all. Also the company will change you for return shipping watch out. Junk, get the $500 Asus if u want a 4k screen
customer_reviews.author: G.B.

customer_reviews.title: programmer: 28" is too small to use at 4k
customer_reviews.text: I am a programmer, and 28" is too small to be used at 4K. I swapped to a 40" (also philips) and it exactly what I wanted. Otherwise the monitor looked pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: diego federici

customer_reviews.title: Not good for windows 8
customer_reviews.text: Windows 8.1 might be to blame... But I don't recommend this monitor. Audio pops. Doesn't come out of sleep right. Sometimes not at all. Messes up your window layout. Could be the graphics card, but I got a new NVIDIA quadro K2000. Whatever it is, it's not working well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
